description: Numbers n such that n = (product of digits of n) * (sum of digits of n).
comments: The list is complete. Proof: One shows that the number of digits is at most 84 and then it is only necessary to consider numbers of the forms 2^i*3^j*7^k and 3^i*5^j*7^k. - _David W. Wilson_, May 16 2003
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Sum-Product Number.
author: _Felice Russo_
